Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PepG1 short  (natural AMPs; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: Produced from the pathogenicity islands of Staphylococcus aureus clinical isolates. inducing their expression triggers S. aureus death. Deposited2014 March 25. The peptides are secreted extracellularly to lyse human erythrocytes. The shorter peptide is more effective against S. aureus rivals.  Deposited2014 March 25 and provided by Prof. Brice Felden.
Literature Information.Author: Pinel-Marie ML, Brielle R and Felden B2014
Literature Information.Title: Dual Toxic-Peptide-Coding Staphylococcus aureus RNA under Antisense Regulation Targets Host Cells and Bacterial Rivals Unequally
